title: Lillian Gish
summary: Lillian Diana Gish[1] (October 14, 1893 – February 27, 1993) was an American actress,[2] director and screenwriter. Her film acting career spanned 75 years, from 1912, in silent film shorts, to 1987. Gish was called "The First Lady of American Cinema", and is credited with pioneering fundamental film performance techniques.[3]
